Reviews.Title: “So bad that I did not want to return to the hotel after a long day!”
Reviews.Author: toh2982
Reviews.Content: Let's start with some + points: (1) Hotel located far from MRT Station but staff was helpful to get cabs for me. That's all for the good points.... NEGATIVE points: (1) First impression into the hotel lobby was OK, nothing fancy but for the price I paid, I could have gotten a better one. (2) Check-in procedure: Quite fast. (3) Enquiries to the hotel manager: no reply despite me calling the front desk 3 times. (4) Room: Worst room I have ever stayed in my life. The carpet was dirty, socket was broken, toilet smells of urine and dirty!! My maid at home can do a better job than the cleaning staff there! (5) The hotel has no water when I woke up at 7am!! The water only came back at 8:10am!! I was late for my meeting because of this! Avoid this hotel at all cost!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Outdated but Good Service”
Reviews.Author: dalozt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located ten minutes away from Orchard road by taxi, which you will have to pay average from eight to ten dollar a ride. The hotel it self is a bit outdated and we have to pay $170 for it (breakfast and internet included) which is for me was a bit expensive compared to Value Inn Thompson or Innotel which around $70-90 a night with modern furniture and else. The room was a bit dump and small (we stayed in standard twin room) but it is okay for business travelers who does not stay much in the hotel. The service from the staff was excellent. The Front Office was really friendly, but the restaurant attendant was not smiling at all. There is also a swimming pool on the 6th floor. The hotel is pretty closed to food court (5 mins walking distance) and nearby also a lot of minimart and a place that sells nice durians. the cons from this hotel is too far from MRT stations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to say, easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: chch2010
Reviews.Content: Great place. Lovely rooms and great staff - very friendly. Very good location. Close to 2 metros which are only a stop or 2 from central Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: monsoonrains
Reviews.Content: The room was itsy bitsy, and it has a cute mini bathtub, which was all ok since all we wanted was a decent place to sleep. The location, it turns out, is not ideal for anything, and every time we take the taxi to go anywhere, it costs S$ 4 just to turn around and come back on the other side of the street! TV channel selection is terrible, nothing to help you wind down as you get ready to sleep. Would not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, If You Want To Just Stay In The Room”
Reviews.Author: LittleBearsBed
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, tidy, and modern. The same can be said for the bathroom. Room included couch and TV. Overall, it was a comfortable stay. HOWEVER, I had stayed all over SE Asia in less modern accommodations and this is the place where some little bug decided to crawl in my ear while sleeping. The main problem with the Quality Hotel in Singapore is that there isn’t anything in the immediate area. Though the rail system can be reached in a 20 minute walk, yhat's a long 20 minutes when it's super humid outside. There aren’t any places to eat in the area. The hotel restaurants are often crowded and over priced. Internet use was expensive and it was inconvenient to return to the desk to get more time for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Discursus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just so-so, for it's price, we can't really complain, although it didn't quite live up to the expectations they did boast about. The site came off attractive with free internet, however, we discovered the internet was only good for one (one laptop, or phone or ipad, just one). The breakfast buffet had a variety which wasn't very good -- food was on the cold side and not very familiar breakfast items. The room was alright with a super tiny safe and nowhere to lock my laptop safely against. For some strange reason, the airconditioner was covered with a tourist brochure -- perhaps it was too cold without it? The shower was alright, strong ang hot. I would recommend this hotel for those who will be out almost the whole day and not just be hanging around the area as there very few places to eat in the neighborhood -- only thing interesting was a movie theater.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tharcas
Reviews.Content: Location Quality Hotel Singapore is not located the best possible spot, and certainly not in walking distance of anything worth seeing. From the rooms, you are able to see some green areas, but again nothing worth seeing. The main impression from a location perspective is, that the hotel is situated at a junction between two main roads (Balestier Rd. and Moulmain Rd.) and a highway Central Expy. Reception and checking in Reception is nice and clean, and our checking in went smooth - at first (see below). Room Our room was on ninth floor, and there was a lot of noise from some renovation going on on 10th floor. Entering our room, it became apparent, that they had made a mistake in our reservation. We were a family of 5 people, and at best we could only fit in 3. After some discussions, they did give us a larger family room, in which we could all fit in (with a mattress on the floor), but still relatively tiny. Room was clean. Restaurant We only had breakfast at the restaurants, since we were out all day. Breakfast was fine and tasty. Restaurant is clean and service Ok. For those, who would prefer something else than asian breakfast, there was only little choice.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Room”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to book this hotel due to overall bad review but we went ahead thinking it was just another weekend getaway anyway. I paid abt sgd145 from online booking with bfast. I was not prepared to be surprised. I didn't really expect too much but I did like the hotel. We were given an 11th floor superior room (non-smoking) with a view from behind the hotel. I figured the room was newly renovated because the paints looked fresh! They provided the basic toiletries, complimentary water, slippers, tea/coffee. The bed was comfy, no smell whatsoever in the room & it was clean. There is a centralized control for the lights, aircon etc. The aircon was too cold though but it was not a concern. TV channels were quite limited. The location is about 10mins taxi ride from the nearest mall & Novena mrt. The staff were polite. The pool is quite small but they have sauna rooms & gym. Only thing is you can hear the closing of the doors of the other rooms. And breakfast was below average. Overall we liked it, no problem going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel on the F1 weekend in September 2011. I had hoped it would live up to it's name however I was very disappointed. It was understaffed, they were rude and the quality of the recently (we were the first to stay in the newly renovated room) renovated room was terrible for a '4 star'. The mirrors had paint on them, the tiles and bathroom was old and had been siliconed like a child had done it. One of the tiles had been siliconed together as a repair. The mattress was terrible and the quality of bedding was also very poor. The minibar was not stocked. There was no concierge or similar. On arrival we could not even access the driveway in a taxi as the car park entrance had broken down and cars were banked up out on to the street. I and other guests had to unload our luggage out the front of a construction site and walk through mud to get the the hotel entrance. The hotel staff could see all this and offered no assistance or apologies.  I was very annoyed at the quality of the hotel we also ran into other guests that had worse problems such as broken air conditioning and unhelpful staff. We had planned on extending our stay if we enjoyed this hotel however we have today moved to another much nicer hotel. When moving hotels I told the taxi driver that they rate themselves as a 4 star. He laughed and said they have closed twice in the last 18 months due to complaints of mould and similar. I am not sure if this is true however i can only comment my experience and it was very poor. Unfortunately I would only rate this hotel as at best a 2.5 star hotel, definitely not 4 star as claimed!

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money, basic, good lunch buffet”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, during F1 race week-end. Quiet part of town, good for walks, but need a bus or taxi to the nearest MRT station. Durian lover? Then stalls are just a few meters away. Rooms are basic, quite old, but will provide basic amenities. Staff are friendly. Heard buffet lunches are good, and I was not disappointed, esp. if you want local cuisine. By staying here, you are a few minutes away from the bustle of Orchard Road by bus or taxi, but Balestier Road is less hectic, so good for liesurely stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very convenient location for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: JCT202
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days 4 nights on Aug 25-29, 2011. There was a renovation going on at the 11th flr and we were located on the 10th flr. We could smell the paint/ varnish all over the 10th flr. There we're drilling sounds and the bathroom ceiling was dripping with water in my dad's room. They had to move to another flr after 2 days. Also, the nearest MRT station (Novena) is far away. In order to go to/from this hotel, you would need to take bus 124 and go down Newton station and the other way around or take a taxi. The bus stop is near the hotel (50 steps away). Not much around the area, its a business area mostly selling tiles. But there are hawkers near the hotel (about 2 blocks away). There is a 711 and Cheers convenient stores very near the hotel. The staff are very friendly. If you are in a large group and need transfers, the hotel can arrange it for you. We requested a one-way transfer going to universal for 6 adults, 1 kid and 1 infant which costs 45sgd.

Reviews.Title: “Kind Staff, Economy Rooms, Don't Drink the Water”
Reviews.Author: Glenn M
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days in the Quality for a business trip, which is located in a convenient location for certain parts of the city and has easy taxi access elsewhere. The hotel is, relative to its price, unusually well-known and filled to capacity given that the accommodations are spartan at best. There is soap in the bathroom, but prepare for the flood you'll create each morning, for example, due to a shower without a real curtain. The air conditioning works, essential in Singapore, and if there is the slightest problem with a system in the building the staff will help you immediately, from their internet to their climate control. Bedding is what you'd buy at Target...including the rock hard mattress. There is no room here, which in Singapore is not something you have to assume. Other hotels have nicer larger rooms in the same price category. The buffet that is included for breakfast is inedible, and the food served by the restaurant more generally would be a shame for anyone to eat if they have any capacity to leave the hotel on foot or by cab. Down the street for example is one of the city's best curry restaurants by all accounts. Pricing for food is outrageous, and the night's entertainment, which resonates through the entire hotel due to insufficient insulation, borders on porn and you'd really think you were in the movie Lost in Translation -- barely dressed women sing bad karaoke and shake it in your face. Actually that is worth seeing. But for about 5 minutes. The desk staff literally said "we totally understand" when after 7 of my 9 days I elected to pay out the remainder of my stay and move to the Intercontinental downtown because I just couldn't take it anymore -- I felt like a hamster in a small cage. My Asian next door neighbor said the same and he was from Tokyo! But the big surprise was yet to come. Two weeks after returning to the U.S. I discovered that I had giardia, a protozoan that is often in unfiltered water in southeast asia. I was assured that it was simply no problem whatsoever to drink the water from the hotel. I boiled it a lot of the time but eventually, every day, the bottle of water in my room ran out and they said "the water is filtered and Singapore water is great." Ask me -- really don't -- what it is like to have giardia. Other than the hotel I didn't have a glass of water anywhere that didn't assuredly have filtered water, and the load of giardia in my system made it obvious that the hotel has the protozoan little monsters loaded up. They aren't lethal, but they transmit to your pets and the outcome is an intestinal nightmare that often doesn't heal for months. Trust me on this one. If you go here, don't drink the water. Or use the ice. PERIOD. But if you are on a TIGHT budget this will do for a couple of nights if you understand what you are getting (and if you don't want to bother to shop around).

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AngelineSkyhotel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and value for money, though location not too impressive. Good housekeeping and rooms were very clean. We'll be back soon...

Reviews.Title: “it has its own culture”
Reviews.Author: SaumilSShah
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good for back packers. it has indian as well as chinese cuisines. the bar in the evening has some good engish live band and plays most of your request. the hotel is off orchard road or CBD by almost 20 mins so one has to normally travel by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Hotel, Cheap, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: kyuelilen
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights and once again were exceptional. Nice rooms, friendly staff, free breakfast and it was one of the few hotels we found in Singapore that wasn't very expensive. Our room was a little small and worn but did the job and nicely decorated. Central air-con, a little fridge and a safe. About location, this hotel is a litter far from Orchard Road. Taxis are plentiful and reasonable though in Singapore (We paid 8 SGD to the Orchard). A little downside: The pool area seems too small but anyway, decent for relaxing after a busy day. However, in general it is a good place and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “its ok but there is better”
Reviews.Author: connie10_10
Reviews.Content: room was ok although i felt i was itching a lot while sleeping. so could be bugs and rooms could be improved. we believed breakfast was included when booking although breakfast was not included. so check before you book. as we went for breakfast, we were informed later that we must pay because it was not included. staff were pushy for us to pay. when my family called, staff did not understand english for the message to be passed. this hotel is nothing special. didnt see a pool or any facilities that appealed to me.

Reviews.Title: “The Excellent & Valuable Hotel in SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: JosephTing
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel during our vacation in Singapore Dec, 2009. My uncle from USA even impressed with the staff that always serves with smile and very helpful especially for a handicapped person. He never expected this great services before we experience it by ourselves. This is what we like to share our experince to everyone out there who plan to visit to Singapore and looking for a luxury and valuable accomodation. "Quality Hotel" must be your choice. 1. Staff are friendly and helpful, they greet you all the time and serves with SMILE. 2. There is a mini lounge which you could relax your mind and even enjoy the great performance. 3. The restaurant offering more than what you expected with the price that you never EXPECTED......... my uncle said "OMG, I wonder how could they earn from this". Can you imagine that Wine Shrimp, Ham.... and the expensive food that you could EAT as much as you want with cheapest price that you only paid.... 4. Room facilities are good and fully completed and suit to your needs during your stay. 5. Wheel chair is provided for free. 6. Ground staff even helps the guest to get taxi to any places that you plan for. 7. Map of interesting places provided at lobby for free for all the guest. 8. Money exchange also provided from desk. As conclusion....We strongly recommend this hotel to everyone. Experience it youself and you;ll be coming back for your next trip for sure

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gree0411
Reviews.Content: Staff was great. Rooms were small, but nice. My only complaint was that the AC wasn't very good in one of the rooms I stayed in. Nice shops and restaurants down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and staff are friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: SydLeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. The hotel room is small but very clean. Bathroom is clean and towels were changed daily. Bed and pillows are too firm. We could hear the people in the next room. Hotel front office staff and the concierge are friendly and helpful. The hotel is a bit far from the usual tourist spots and the nearest MRT station is about a kilometer away so took a taxi most of the time. The hotel provides a shuttle service and best to book with the concierge beforehand. Shuttle only takes you to the nearest MRT station and Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: Barbie1976
Reviews.Content: The main reason we booked the Quality Hotel as it was one of the few hotels we found in Singapore that wasn't very expensive so we weren't expecting a lot but in actual fact it was more than adequate and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending it. When we checked in, although we'd requested a double bed we were given 2 singles. I called reception and they were helpful and said if we could wait an hour or so they'd give us a double room so we left our rucksacks at reception and went for a wander while they cleaned the double room for us. The hotel is about 40 minutes walk from Orchard Road, we did this walk on numerous occasions though as it was a pleasant walk. The nearest underground station was about 15 minutes walk way. Taxis are plentiful and reasonable though in Singapore. Our room was of a good standard and nicely decorated. The pool area was small but decent for relaxing after a busy day in Singapore. Breakfast was included and was very good. If you're not bothered about being a bit outside the main areas of Singapore this is a fantastic choice and real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “real quality..”
Reviews.Author: emberPhilippines
Reviews.Content: I surf the tripadvisor to search for a descent hotel in Singapore with an affordable price and I found Quality hotel rated average mostly by the travelers. So I checked with their website, they happened to have promotional rate for Filipinos (116 SGD with breakfast for two). At first I was hesitant since I am traveling with my spouse and my five yr old son, so I wanted to make sure that we will be comfortable with our stay. But since I found mostly the reviews of Quality hotel with a positive feedback from the travelers, I decided to book in to this hotel. Although we arrive at around 1am , we didn’t encounter problems during check-in. We were immediately assisted by the hotel staff, who happens to be a Filipino. The room we got is just an average size, enough for us - not too big, but not too small. The bathroom also is just an average size, but clean with a marble floor. The only problem I notice is the noisy sound of the bath tub after using it and the aircondition is too cold even if it is adjusted to low already. The food during breakfast has enough selection, but mostly asian cuisine. I found the food not the best but it is ok, even my kid like their chicken sausage. Their lobby is quite charming, even my cousin working in singapore notice the good ambiance when they happened to visit us in the hotel, they’re surprise with the good deal we have with Qaulity hotel. Mostly of their staff are Filipinos, we were guided where should we go, or what station near the tourist attraction. The location of the hotel is not near on the main shopping center of Singapore, but for me I found it ok. As I observe the location is quite, not too overcrowded and it is accessible. We were able to take their complimentary shuttle service going to novena station , but available only at weekdays. Overall, I could rate the hotel with excellent service. I will definitely recommend it to other family that will travel to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “holiday to visit family”
Reviews.Author: jonasluck1234
Reviews.Content: did a stop over here in july 2007 on the way to the phillipines stayed 4 nights when we arrived after a long flight we were given an incorrect room having requested a double they told us all they had available was a twin with two single beds since i prepaid i was a little annoyed about this as was my wife however we put up with it for one night as they said a double would be available in the morning . the hotel itself is located abit far out of town as other reviewers have said taxis however are cheap costing about nz 5 to 10 both ways the shopping is fantastic and recommend orchard road as a great first stop also we went on tour and did singapore zoo by night and also a guided tour of the local sidewalk stalls which my wife loved. had to demand the double bed three times and after alot of calls to reception got it , the view in our second room was also alot better as well,the hotel has a small swimming pool and it was great for a plunge when we got back ,water was also safe to drink from the taps not like manila. breakfast was free and had good variety such as bacon eggs coffee and toast continental available as well a voucher was given to u so you could get it for free. around the hotel there is very little in the way of attractions in either direction very muggy and humid air as well coming fron nz it took a lttle getting used to ,air conditioning in the rooms was wonderful and man on some days a godsend, this is a good place to stay however recommend u use free shuttle from hotel or taxis to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of Singapore..”
Reviews.Author: TravelTipsKrishna
Reviews.Content: About the Hotel : I was searching for a hotel that has good interirors at not very exorbitant rates and that is near to a MRT station. I found that all hotels that are nearby MRT stations were expensive ! I found out about Quality Hotel Singapore from the internet and made my reservations for 4 days at a stretch ... The rooms have state-of-the art facilities. I would not say that the rooms were big but it was adequate for two. The ambience was the best that we could ask for... Location : this hotel is about 15-20 minutes walk from Novena MRT station. A cab in normal hour may cost about 2 to 3 SGD for a drop to station. If its evening or night time, you could walk down from the station to the hotel. Food : We had the complimentary buffet breakfast that was lavish in its own style. If you are vegetarian, then you need to be happy with the sandwiches , juices and croissants...If you are not too particular about vegetarian food, then the choice is plenty Rooms : each room is well made and does make the stay at Singapore a memorable one. There is a swimming pool on the level 4 and a gym and Sauna nearby.. In all, this is a perfect hotel for business and for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Taxi transport a must for this place”
Reviews.Author: derek0113
Reviews.Content: They did say that they ran a shuttle bus to Orchard Road, but not, alas a weekends, the room was basic, but we couldn't get the room set at a suitable temperature as the stat was clicking on and off at 15oC and it was far more than that, I suspect it was set at a cooling load. no extra blankets. The advertised Internet in each room was a false statement, but they coughed up the cash to allow me to surf for 30 minutes free. On the positive, the breakfast was good the staff were very polite, the rooms clean and ideal for our stay, but I would advise selecting a hotel closer to an MRT station or the hub of the city

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel - a little way out of the main district for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Jetset
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed chose to stay at this hotel for 5 nights in November 2008 for our annual shopping/sightseeing trip. I had last been to Singapore about 12 years ago and therefore had a fair idea of where everything was. The hotel is a little way from Orchard Road and therefore you needed to take the courtesy bus (Mon - Fri only) to either the nearest MRT station or Orchard Road. The hotel was very comfortable though the room was quite small, but as we don't spend much time in our room this was fine. Breakfast each morning was OK. Though if you like the usual Full English Breakfast you may be a bit disappointed. Lots of Chinese food at Breakfast. We didn't eat in the Restaurant but did use the Bar Meal Menu. This was good food and very reasonably priced, either eating outside or inside the bar where there was a group playing each night. There is also a satay area set up outside which is very good. The staff were very friendly but any requests took days and several requests before you got what you needed. We asked for extra towels and after 2 days of requesting each morning we were given extra blankets. We asked again on the 3rd day (twice) and finally got 2 extra towels. We checked out at the usual time but as our flights were not until midnight we asked for a courtesy room to freshen up in before our journey home. We were told to go to the pool area and use the shower room there. This was quite cramped for 2 of us with our luggage, but we managed to take a shower and freshen up. We were given a voucher for a complimentary drink which can be used at anytime during your stay, which is nice, and although we paid for room only we were given a voucher on arrival for breakfast every morning. If you are happy to travel to the sights and shops this is a good base, but as the courtesy bus does not run at weekends you will need to use taxis but these are frequently coming to/from the hotel and we had no trouble getting one when we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in a very hot climate!”
Reviews.Author: scottcabal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality hotel as it was the cheapest hotel that was available with the exact package I booked through my travel agent. I didn't expect anything amazing, but was pleasently surprised with a very nice hotel with a nice room, good food and friendly staff. It is located on Balestier Road which is a little bit outside of the city centre (an hour or more walk) but the subway is at the end of the road and during the week a free shuttle is provided hourly to take you to the subway and Orchard Road shopping district. The neighbourhood the hotel is in is more local than touristy which is nice. The shuttle doesn't operate at weekends so I decided to walk all the way to Orchard Road. It was a very exhausting walk but I saw some nice places I wouldn't have otherwise seen. However I really would not recommend the walk - my shoes actually completely broke in half in the sole and disintegrated around the seams from the heat and humidity. There is a shopping mall near the hotel though which remedied this. If you stay here at the weekend, the shuttle isn't operating and you don't want to walk to the subway then just get a taxi - they are efficient, friendly and cheap all around Singapore. The room was clean, functional, with a nice view, good TV channels and VERY good air conditioning which trust me you will need all the time you are in your room. The room is a nice place to relax if you are tired, or if you are escaping the heavy rain storms which occur for half hour or so every afternoon. The breakfast at the hotel was nice. It included a selection of everything for everybody but also some things you wouldn't expect in a hotel in the UK (rice for breakfast for example). It also had chicken sausages which I've never had but were really nice. The staff at the hotel were VERY friendly and helpful. They always had a smile on their face, made checkin go smoothly, always prided themselves in giving good service etc. They were also helpful with any query or request you had. For example my flight didn't depart until 22.30 and I was being picked up at 7pm. They allowed me to keep my room until 6pm for no extra charge. Tip for people that stay here - you each receive a voucher for a free welcome drink when you arrive at the hotel. This can be used at any time during your stay so it's quite nice to sit and relax with it before departing if you have an afternoon departure. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here and would highly recommend it to others. It is not a huge world-class or 5 star hotel like Raffles but if you are after a nice, affordable, friendly hotel in a quieter location (if that's possible in Singapore) then this is a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “quality it is”
Reviews.Author: rafaman
Reviews.Content: The Quality Hotel is located on Balestier Road which is a little way out of the city centre. It is a quiet location but the MRT is ten minutes (hot) walk away so it is neccessary to use a taxi when going out. The staff are very polite and extremely obliging - nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are large, clean and very well serviced. There is a smal swimming pool and a gym. The resturaunt serves a mixture of European and Chinese cuisine. Prices are very reasonable. The bar and lounge areas are very comfortable. Except for the location, it is difficult to fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: xxxhellotherexxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the quality hotel as a stop off point on our way to Melbourne with 2 elderly people, and 1 teenager. The hotels first impressions were great. It was clean, spacious, and the lobby was grand and also nice and cool, a relief from the humidity outside! The lifts were very good, regular, clean, and you could only use them with your room card, making you feel extra safe. Our room was lovely, also clean, and quite spacious, and the tv was avaialbe for use for free, which is good as some hotels make you pay for it. The surrounding area was nice, it was good just to admire the many coloured buildings. There was a small range of shops, mostly either cafes or electrical. Although there was a mc donalds just down the road which sort of spoilt it! The overall service of the hotel was very good, and the main city was only a short taxi journey or train ride away. The food was excellent, lots and lots of choice, all well cooked and freshly made. Overall, I would definitley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: PolskiSparky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days/ 5 nights and we could not fault the staff or the service provided, the disabled rooms are bit small especially if a wheel chair is needed, but the sheets were changed daily, the bathroom (disabled for me) was just what I needed and can never find in many other establishments, though surprising their was not a hot water tap at the sink for shaving???? cold water only, otherwise I would give this hotel 5 stars. We will be returning again, and cannot recommend this hotel enough, thank you for the enjoyable stay. The internet is very expensive to use in the hotel, especially when their are so many much cheaper internet cafes available and free wireless in local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “An OK value if you put up with the poor location and service”
Reviews.Author: cybertraveler14
Reviews.Content: The first impressions of the hotel are good, as the lobby looks very nice. However, the service left a lot to be desired. We tried to check in at 17:00, but they didn’t have a room ready, despite signs saying they had 40 some rooms available. After about a 15 minute wait, we were finally given our keys. The room was very basic, but was fairly large as we had a triple. Judging by the fire diagram on the door, the other rooms were much smaller. The location wasn’t very good—it is about a 15-20 minute walk to the nearest metro station (Novena) and the hotel’s free shuttle only runs a few times each day. The bus does stop near the hotel, so if you figure out the bus routes that is a decent alternative. Our room was quiet and clean enough, so if we got an excellent bargain, we might consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “First visit”
Reviews.Author: DennisWestWickham
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel on our way back from Sydney, booked by our travel agents. (Not our first choice) The hotel is quite a way out from most locations and is sited alongside a hospital. The hotel is good and welcoming and we were pleased with our room - comfortable and welcome air conditioning, large TV and master controls by bedside etc. We enjoyed a trip into the main shopping centre on the hotels courtesy bus but they did rather "dump us" in a place we felt compeletely lost in. We got a taxi back later. Food was good and the evening late buffet was excellemt value. However we did feel very rushed in the breakfast restaurant. We - and other diners-were advised several times that the restaurant closed at 10am but at 9.45am the lights were switched off and waiters hovered as we put our eating utensils down ready to clear everything the moment we put it down. That said, the staff were generally helpful and the hotel was clean. The lady attending to the rooms was excellent and very helfpul. We would like to visit Singapore again as we could not see everything in the time available but probably we would aim to stay rather closer to the main parts. Some local shops nearby but especially useful if you like lighting shops- there were dozens!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Traveltart
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this Hotel in January 2006 for 2 nights and it was wonderful. The staff were friendly and helpful and the included breakfast was buffet style and very good. Our room was small but clean and had a full bathroom with a safe in the cupboard. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty of hot water. We were on the eighth floor and had a lovely view out of our window. The free shuttle bus took us to Orchard Road each morning and we took a taxi back. Taxi's are cheap and plentiful. After checking out of the Hotel in the morning they held our luggage 'til we returned at 7pm and the concierge asked us if we'd like to freshen up before going to the airport. He gave us fresh towels and escorted us to the pool area where we showered and changed our clothes. Then he arranged a taxi for us, all without being asked and after we'd checked out! I booked this Hotel through the internet and paid only SGD$158.00 for the 2 nights. Bargain! Impressive Hotel, helpful efficient staff, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stop.”
Reviews.Author: suntrip62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night on our way to KL. Booked the hotel at the airport and arrived very late. Everything worked out fine and the staff seemed nice and proper. Room was nice and clean. The pool was a little bit small but a least there was a pool. Located a bit on the outskirts of town, but taxi is pretty cheap. The breakfast-lounge was a bit crowded and the breakfast was ok, but not more.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: yafm
Reviews.Content: booked thru a web site and requested twin beds and non smoking. booked in -allowed in early - but no twin available until next day smooth swop next day and clean, comfortable beds (pillows a bit hard). First room quieter than second as on different side of hotel. Breakfast reasonable plenty and hot. Staff friendly and swim pool well maintained and empty so being small does not matter. Will use it again as taxi's plentiful and cheap

Reviews.Title: “OK but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 2 adults and 2 children from Canada on its offical website. The booking procedures went well and confirmation was received almost immediately. We requested a non-smoking room but was told that it could not guarantee the request. The hotel is also one of the very few hotels in Singapore that allows 2 adults and 2 kids in a single room. We arrived just after midnight and the check-in was very smooth. We find the room ok but the mini-fridge never worked (even after a repair and a swap). The stopper for the bath tup was missing. Hotel is generally clean. Unfortunately, the hotel accepts tour groups (mainly Chinese and Japanese) which could arrive late and were very noisy. After 6 days, we moved out and cancel the rest of the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, will return.”
Reviews.Author: poppypicanto
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel located slightly away from all the main attractions of Singapore, but that isn't a bad thing as taxi's are cheap (about 80p for two passengers to Orchard Road and takes about 10 mins). The hotel staff will go to any lengths to please and provide as they also run a free shuttle bus service every hour (only on week days though). The standard rooms are slightly on the smaller size but immaculate with new fittings, clean beds, great facilities such as tv, electronic safe, hair dryer and everything you could need. (just take extra hangers as they don't provide more than a handful, and the wardrobe was a little tight on space for two people). Again, the staff are great and nothing is any trouble from requesting an iron, to the breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet was very good and every type of food was available to try. I will revisit for sure. If you have booked this hotel then you won't have any concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: themoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected this hotel based on price and were not sure what to expect. We have stayed in Singapore before and find that it is a difficult city to find good hotel rates and quality, usually one is at the expense of the other. It turned out to be a great value. The staff is very professional and friendly. The public areas are all very nice.The room was compact but clean, and included a small fridge, tea and coffee facilities and a safe, the bathroom was all marble, and the T.V had many channels to choose from. We requested extra hangers and softer pillows and were promptly and happily accommodated. Breakfast (included in our rate) could be eaten in a lounge area or on the patio outside. It was not the best I have ever had, but it did offer a number of food choices that varied a bit day to day and certainly left you full and ready to start your day. The pool and sundeck area were small but spotless. Luckily not many guests bother to use it so we would usually have it all to ourselves. The hotel also offers a free shuttle service to Orchard Rd or a nearby shopping mall. We used it once and found it very pleasant and efficient. The location is away from the tourist areas in a quiet residential part of town. It is a 15 minute walk to either Ferrer Park or Novena MRT stations. The area around either station has shops and restaurants so you don't have to go downtown to indulge in either (don't miss shopping at the Mustafa Center). We had a very early morning flight and the final taxi fare to the airport including the 50% surcharge (between midnight and 6:00 am) was less than 20 singapore dollars If you are looking for a reasonable rate at a solid 3* this hotel is ideal.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Hotel Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 201 Balestier Road, Singapore 329926, Singapore
